info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 6:08AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Big Blue River at Shelbyville.
Muscatatuck River at Vernon.
Flatrock River near Columbus.
Driftwood River near Edinburgh.
East Fork White River at Columbus to Seymour and at Williams.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
East Fork White River near Rivervale to Bedford and at Shoals.
.Significant and some major flooding is already occurring or expected to develop along the East Fork White River and its immediate tributaries in Shelby and Bartholomew Counties...due to multiple rounds of heavy rainfall...and additional rains expected through Sunday. The crest on the East Fork should be in the Columbus and Seymour areas around Sunday evening and points downstream thereafter.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...East Fork White River at Williams.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, During the March 2008 flood these roads remained flooded according to the Bedford Times: Peerless Road, Lawrenceport Tunnelton Road, Pumphouse Road, Indiana State Road 450, Stumphole Bridge Road, Mill Creek Road, Earl Road, Dillon Road, River Road and Rager Road.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this morning to 13.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall tomorrow evening. It will rise to 18.4 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 915 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
